item.title: New Orleans Attack on New Year’s Turns Celebration Into Terror
item.description: The attack that left 15 dead and about three dozen injured followed a distressingly familiar pattern of assailants turning vehicles into weapons.

item.title: Elon Musk accused of trying to weaken Europe with support for far-right AfD party
item.description: Germany's vice chancellor said Musk's comments calling the far-right AfD a "last spark of hope" weren't made out of ignorance.

item.title: Montenegro Shooting Kills 12, Including 2 Children, Officials Say
item.description: The authorities in the small Balkan country reported after a search that the gunman, whose rampage followed a bar fight, had been found dead.

item.title: Debate Over U.S. Sanctions on Russia For Ukraine War Intensifies
item.description: The president-elect has said he will use sanctions sparingly while vowing to end the war in Ukraine, renewing questions over their efficacy.

item.title: Employee stock options: 3 things to know
item.description: If options are part of your compensation package, it’s worth your while to get familiar with how they work.

item.title: Remote work impeded women’s careers, CEO of top U.K. bank claims amid industry-wide RTO surge
item.description: "Being seen" is critical to career development, Debbie Crosbie said, arguing that remote work makes female employees appear absent.
